title: Quiz 4: Nutrition Assessment & Malnutrition
description: Evaluate your ability to assess nutritional status using MUAC, identify edema, and distinguish between Marasmus and Kwashiorkor.

questions.question: A MUAC measurement of less than 115mm (11.5cm) represented by RED color indicates:
questions.explanation: Red (<11.5cm) indicates Severe Acute Malnutrition requiring immediate referral.

questions.question: Match the type of malnutrition with its characteristic signs:

pairs.right: Extremely emaciated, 'old man's face', ribs visible
Severe swelling (edema), moon face, hair changes

questions.explanation: Marasmus is wasting (thin); Kwashiorkor involves edema (swelling).

questions.question: Order the steps for checking for nutritional edema:

items.text: Apply thumb pressure to tops of feet

questions.explanation: You press both feet -> hold for 3s -> release -> look for the pit.

questions.question: Nutritional edema is characterized by pitting on ___BLANK___ feet.
questions.explanation: Nutritional edema is bilateral (occurs on both feet simultaneously).

questions.question: Why is MUAC (Mid-Upper Arm Circumference) used for nutrition assessment?

options.text: It is a better indicator of mortality risk than weight-for-height
It is less prone to mistakes than weight-for-height

questions.explanation: MUAC is a rapid, effective tool that predicts mortality risk well and is easy to use in the community.
questions.hint: Think about its advantages in a community setting.

questions.question: A child has a MUAC of 12.0 cm. What color code is this on the MUAC tape?
questions.explanation: Measurements between 11.5cm and 12.5cm fall in the Yellow zone (Moderate Acute Malnutrition).
questions.hint: It is between Red and Green.

questions.question: Analyze the table below. What is the correct action for a child with a MUAC of 11.0 cm?

richContent.content:
CategoryIndicatorAction
SAM (Red)< 11.5cmRefer for Treatment
MAM (Yellow)11.5 - 12.4cmRefer for Supplementation

options.text: Refer to health facility for treatment

questions.explanation: 11.0 cm is < 11.5 cm (Red/SAM), requiring referral for treatment.

questions.question: MUAC can be used to measure all pregnant women and women up to 6 months postpartum.
questions.explanation: MUAC is independent of pregnancy weight gain and serves as a proxy for nutrient reserves.
questions.hint: It helps assess adult malnutrition in these groups.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the skin condition often seen in Kwashiorkor?
questions.explanation: Kwashiorkor is associated with damaged skin, changes in color, and a 'flaky paint' appearance.
questions.hint: Contrast this with the loose skin of Marasmus.

questions.question: What is the referral criteria for a mother based on MUAC measurement?
questions.explanation: A mother with a MUAC less than 21cm should be referred to the health facility.
questions.hint: It is a specific measurement in cm.
